revised_title: Errata and Publication Guidelines of Philosophical Transactions
tldr: The Royal Society's Committee responsible for the publication of Philosophical Transactions provides an update on their process and guidelines. They clarify that they do not give opinions on the content of the papers, but rather select papers based on their importance, singularity, or advantageous treatment. They also mention a rule to never give their opinion as a body.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > History of Science
